lexUnit.name: shuffle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: walk by dragging one's feet along or without lifting them fully from the ground.

sentence.text: My oldest brothers Jack and Charlie had turned up and were shuffling about , getting in everyone 's way , and Dad lit the candles so that the flickering glow shed an eerie light .
When Mrs Jones shuffled across to the inspector , her face was benign and placid , impossible to read .
He shuffled across to where Madra lay and shooed Riven out of the way .
They shuffle about in a rapt way to these radiant arches of sound , punctuated by the thunder of dub-style percussion .
Smoke from a row of barbecues mixes with the dust of perhaps 15,000 people shuffling along the wooden stalls to shop for meat , antibiotics , the latest fashions , even , it is said , used cars .
A man wearing a hat he 'd painted and twisted into an unrecognizable shape shuffled along the corridor , pointing upwards with a contorted grimace .
He watched her as she danced a few larky steps with her daughter , singing in an effortfully pure soprano while Maisie shuffled along trying to keep the sweets safe under her jumper .
Defries pointed to the winged creatures spiralling down towards them , and then to a contingent of androids shuffling along the girder .
I stay a few feet behind , watching the three of them shuffle along at a ten-month-old 's pace .

There were hundreds , thousands , of these old reprobates shuffling around the streets of London sleeping in cardboard boxes or dosshouses , begging and scrambling their brains with cheap booze and meths .
He then shuffled around the room cupping his hand around the chimneys and blowing out one lamp after another .
She shuffled around uncomfortably , finally deciding to cut the bread because it was the one thing she could at least guarantee not to spoil .
Craig is still Noddy , the hot-headed drummer , forever telling Clint he 's talking ` fookin' bollocks " , Martyn is still Bungle the bassist shuffling around with his hands in his pockets .
The old man mumbled and shuffled away .
Ruth heard the old footsteps shuffling away .
The waiter bowed until his head nearly banged the table , then shuffled away .
With a quantity of black looks and complaints , the Guildsmen shuffled away towards their homes , and the Bishop blessed them as they went .
This allows the machine-chisel to shuffle back and forth , stepping down to full depth .
The man shuffled back a few paces , bent almost double .
Bert shuffled back through the door into the boarded off section of the garage , followed by Yanto , who was frustrated by the old man 's slowness .
He shuffles back to the sofa and drops heavily into his seat .
When she has shuffled back behind her counter I nod at Jamie 's pile of food .
From there we had to shuffle down the underground to Davenports Magic Shop , where Paul had been lured in order to buy an ancient Chinese trick , hence the coolie gear .
When Eric Cantona , having completed his first full 90 minutes , embraced Mark Hughes at the end of this significant victory , it was apt that McClair should quietly shuffle down the tunnel .
Satisfied , he shuffled down into the back passage and opened the door of the closet under the stairs .
Indeed , as members shuffle in to vote on this issue vital to Mr Major 's survival , the suspense will be as killing as in any Indiana Jones movie .
Mr McWhirter had shuffled in , looking like a morose vagrant , some ten minutes late , and had taken up a position in front of the fire .

And the two of them shuffling in with the hoods of their duffel coats over their heads and their school scarves pulled over noses and mouths like a pair of monks doing the rounds during the Black Death .
She pulled herself up on her walking-frame and shuffled off , pushing it in front of her , towards the kitchen .
Josh shuffled off down the lip of the basin still sieving the water .
Statistically , most Koi that shuffle off the mortal scale do so within two or three years of existence .

If artists have to address the fact that AIDS-sufferers shuffle off this mortal coil faster than most of the rest of humanity , perhaps the arts most closely linked to the body can express the idea best .
She grunted her assent and shuffled off to collect Klift .
As the old man shuffled off into the drizzle Henry quickened his pace .
The attendant , now adding a sulk to his sullenness , had shuffled off to the kitchen area .
The tramp tossed the empty cup away and shuffled off in the other direction .
However , she is quite dolorous , and sighting her , or hearing her crying as she slowly shuffles by , are both very bad omens .
The congregation stood up and amiably shuffled out , shaking hands as they did so .
The tall hunchbacked figure of Bert Midgeley came shuffling out .
` You and I might as well be getting back to Zimmerman 's , Richter , " said Moreau as they shuffled out into the street .
Fifi shuffled over and stood behind her , eager to share in the bounty .
A boy with a cardboard box on his head and two cardboard boxes on his feet shuffles over .
Forlornly , I shuffled over to the machine and took another number .
He shuffled over towards the corner and collapsed on to a comfortable sofa .
He then shuffled over to the girl at the Swissair sales desk and asked her to book him on the first available flight to Geneva .
We greeted them but no one returned our salutations ; instead , as we approached , they shuffled round and turned their backs on us .
Thoroughly exasperated by this lack of information when she wanted all the details , she shuffled round and went back into the lounge .
She held the door open as he shuffled through sideways with the bag , and then closed it behind him and led the way up the stairs .
Peter Gaskell shuffled through in his oversized wellingtons , a large empty canvas bag flapping against his knees .
Auks swim and dive readily and constantly , but on land can only shuffle awkwardly .
But he shuffled backwards anyway .
The aides of both men had begun to shuffle closer once again , anxious not to be completely out of earshot .
Gabriel shuffled forwards , crippled with terror .
Mumtaz shuffled forward bearing a white tray on which a mangled piece of pink metal had been wrapped in plastic .
The queue shuffled forward a little .
Chastened , you pick up the bicycle and shuffle indoors , convinced you have ruined everything for good .

They had spilled halfway across the road , and although most of them shuffled quickly aside when they saw the car approaching , four boys gathered themselves quickly into a group and remained standing defiantly in its path .
Stephanie watched him dance or shuffle , two steps forward , one back , almost sideways along the paved path .
He shuffled straight past Toby , eyes fixed straight ahead , and arrived at 4A one minute before his class was due to begin .
He seemed bewildered , shuffled about his room yawning and stretching , and only after several minutes of this focused on Wilson at all .
The moon was a slender crescent , and a few tattered clouds shuffled across the perfect dome of blue-black sky .
She shuffled across the kitchen to the sink .
Old men shuffle across the tiles to be greeted with ` Good afternoon , milord " , by tailcoated attendants .
Mr Douglas Hurd in the House yesterday shuffled uneasily between Washington wrath and Hanoi despair .
The yellow-jacketed policeman shuffled uneasily from foot to foot , uncertain of what they should be doing now .
Emmie shuffled from one foot to the other .
Ludo and I shuffle from pub to pub , table to table , like the Salvation Army rattling tins .
I saw the outlandish figure shuffling into the dock .
The runner soon returns and we all shuffle soggily into the hut .
The lodgers shuffle into line as if places were limited , like on a crowded bus .
Preceded by a cloud of vaporised breath , a figure shuffled into the light spilling from the Hall .
A long moment later Herkimer Housebound , the ancient turtle , shuffled into view .
Willie carried on imagining that his dirty feet were wrapped in rags and newspapers and when the scene came to an end he shuffled slowly off the stage .
He quickly shuffled forward on his knees to keep up .
A battalion of infantry that was marching towards the cabriolet shuffled onto the grass verge .
Mafouz shuffled up to the bowling crease and started to wind his right arm backwards at high speed .
He shuffled out of the courtyard , his over-sized shoes flapping noisily on the stone floor .
He shuffled forward with bent head and arms folded tightly about his body as if he felt a mortal chill enclosing him .
The explosions started as soon as the last elephant had shuffled out of sight .
In between the shelled-out buildings , people shuffle like the walking dead -- thousands thronging to the feeding centres hastily set up by relief agencies .
Goebbels watched the broken figure of Hirschfeldt shuffle out the door .
Hebden 's face had collapsed back into a mask of indifference and Mrs Jones shuffled past him without a second glance .
Coolies shuffled past them .
Johnny Dee winked lewdly , and he and Kelley shuffled backwards through the doorway and were gone .
She shuffled through the pack again .
` No , " she said desperately , and turned and walked away , mingling with the throng that shuffled through the narrow streets rubbing shoulders with each other .
Draping a cloak round his crooked figure , he leaned on his cane and shuffled awkwardly to the door .
As I stepped into my skis and shuffled to the edge of the steep snow slope , I remembered Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid , tailed to the edge of a very high cliff by the posse .

He shuffled awkwardly towards the door .
The stage darkened and the audience shuffled reluctantly towards the exit-doors .
The small , cowled figure shuffled towards him .
